name: Barli Development Institute for Rural Women
briefDescription: Barli Development Institute for Rural Women is an independent non-governmental non-profit organization registered in Indore, (Madhya Pradesh, India). The Institute has been working towards building capacities and improving life skills of young rural and tribal women for achieving sustainable development of their communities since past 30 years, and has trained more than 7800 women , who had come from more than 780 villages in the region. After the training, the women carry home the learnings and conduct follow-up voluntary service activities for enhancing literacy, health and education of rural areas, thus becoming agents of social change in their respective rural and tribal communities.
